Description: Steatite shabti of Psamtek with a lappet-wig, a carved face with a beard, the hands are unmarked, there is a back pillar inscribed with Hieroglyphs recording the offering of food to Osiris of Coptos by Psamtek, the feet rest on a plinth.
Curator's comments: Though identified as a shabti, this figure almost certainly had a different function. It lacks the hoe, mattock and basket (standard attributes of Late Period shabtis) and instead of the shabti spell (Book of the Dead chapter 6) is inscribed with an offering formula. This, together with the absence of hands and the inclusion of a pedestal, suggests that the figure should be classified with Ptah-Sokar-Osiris statues. As such, it would be a very rare example of this type of figure in stone.
